publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2176 Pauline McNeill: Future of Glasgow Underground-That the Parliament supports Bill Miller MEP in his efforts to exempt the Glasgow underground system from any European legislation which would force all public transport systems across Europe to go out to tender for five-year contracts and notes that the tendering process could cost Strathclyde Passenger Transport £10 million that could instead be spent on improving the service for passengers.
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Johann Lamont*

S1M-2176 Pauline McNeill: Future of Glasgow Underground-That the Parliament supports Bill Miller MEP in his efforts to exempt the Glasgow underground system from any European legislation which would force all public transport systems across Europe to go out to tender for five-year contracts and notes that the tendering process could cost Strathclyde Passenger Transport £10 million that could instead be spent on improving the service for passengers. Supported by: Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Patricia Ferguson*
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Robin Harper*
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Elaine Smith*
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Trish Godman*

S1M-2176 Pauline McNeill: Future of Glasgow Underground—That the Parliament supports Bill Miller MEP in his efforts to exempt the Glasgow underground system from any European legislation which would force all public transport systems across Europe to go out to tender for five-year contracts and notes that the tendering process could cost Strathclyde Passenger Transport £10 million that could instead be spent on improving the service for passengers. Supported by: Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan, Patricia Ferguson, Robin Harper, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Elaine Smith, Trish Godman
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Hugh Henry*

S1M-2176 Pauline McNeill: Future of Glasgow Underground-That the Parliament supports Bill Miller MEP in his efforts to exempt the Glasgow underground system from any European legislation which would force all public transport systems across Europe to go out to tender for five-year contracts and notes that the tendering process could cost Strathclyde Passenger Transport £10 million that could instead be spent on improving the service for passengers. Supported by: Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan, Patricia Ferguson, Robin Harper, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Elaine Smith, Trish Godman, Irene Oldfather, Hugh Henry
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Cathy Jamieson*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-2176 Pauline McNeill: Future of Glasgow Underground-That the Parliament supports Bill Miller MEP in his efforts to exempt the Glasgow underground system from any European legislation which would force all public transport systems across Europe to go out to tender for five-year contracts and notes that the tendering process could cost Strathclyde Passenger Transport £10 million that could instead be spent on improving the service for passengers. Supported by: Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan, Patricia Ferguson, Robin Harper, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Elaine Smith, Trish Godman, Irene Oldfather, Hugh Henry, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Jamie Stone
S1M-2176 Future of Glasgow Underground (lodged on 5 September 2001) Bill Butler*
